title: 1999/335/EC: Commission Decision of 7 May 1999 approving the plans presented by Germany for the eradication of classical swine fever in feral pigs in Baden Württemberg and Rhineland-Palatinate (notified under document number C(1999) 1177) (Only the German text is authentic) (Text with EEA relevance)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION
of 7 May 1999
approving the plans presented by Germany for the eradication of classical swine fever in feral pigs in Baden W端rttemberg and Rhineland-Palatinate
(notified under document number C(1999) 1177)
(Only the German text is authentic)
(Text with EEA relevance)
(1999/335/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The plans submitted by Germany for the eradication of classical swine fever in feral in pigs in Baden-W端rttemberg and Rhineland-Palatinate are hereby approved.
Germany shall bring into force the laws, regulations and administrative provisions for implementing the plans referred to in Article 1.
This Decision is addressed to the Federal Republic of Germany.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 7 May 1999.
For the Commission
Franz FISCHLER
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ L 47, 21.2.1980, p. 11.
